alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Washington and east central Penobscot Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 515 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wytopitlock, or 12 miles west of Danforth, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Danforth, Topsfield, Codyville Plantation, Prentiss, Kingman, Codyville, Drew Plantation, Brookton, Forest, Eaton, Lambert Lake and Forest City. This includes US Highway 1 between Brookton and Eaton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
